claim: The highest-viewed post is authored by the account "Community."
extra_info: Higher view count means the post has higher popularity; the most popular post refers to MAX(ViewCount);
reasoning: The highest-viewed post (Id=31, ViewCount=175,495) is authored by user 'Sharpie' (UserId=13), not 'Community' (UserId=-1). The claim is directly contradicted by the data.

content.content:
CREATE TABLE posts
(
    Id                    INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    PostTypeId            INTEGER          null,
    AcceptedAnswerId      INTEGER          null,
    CreaionDate           DATETIME     null,
    Score                 INTEGER          null,
    ViewCount             INTEGER          null,
    Body                  TEXT     null,
    OwnerUserId           INTEGER          null,
    LasActivityDate       DATETIME     null,
    Title                 TEXT null,
    Tags                  TEXT null,
    AnswerCount           INTEGER          null,
    CommentCount          INTEGER          null,
    FavoriteCount         INTEGER          null,
    LastEditorUserId      INTEGER          null,
    LastEditDate          DATETIME     null,
    CommunityOwnedDate    DATETIME    null,
    ParentId              INTEGER          null,
    ClosedDate            DATETIME     null,
    OwnerDisplayName      TEXT null,
    LastEditorDisplayName TEXT null,
        foreign key (LastEditorUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (OwnerUserId) references users (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade,
        foreign key (ParentId) references posts (Id)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE users
(
    Id              INTEGER          not null UNIQUE
        primary key,
    Reputation      INTEGER          null,
    CreationDate    DATETIME     null,
    DisplayName     TEXT null,
    LastAccessDate  DATETIME     null,
    WebsiteUrl      TEXT null,
    Location        TEXT null,
    AboutMe         TEXT     null,
    Views           INTEGER          null,
    UpVotes         INTEGER          null,
    DownVotes       INTEGER          null,
    AccountId       INTEGER          null,
    Age             INTEGER          null,
    ProfileImageUrl TEXT null
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT p.Id, p.ViewCount, p.OwnerUserId, p.OwnerDisplayName, u.DisplayName FROM posts p LEFT JOIN users u ON p.OwnerUserId = u.Id ORDER BY p.ViewCount DESC LIMIT 5;"

content.text:
The highest-viewed post (Id=31, ViewCount=175495) is authored by user with OwnerUserId=13, whose DisplayName is "Sharpie", not "Community."

Let me also check if there's a user named "Community" in the database:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/codebase_community.sqlite" "SELECT * FROM users WHERE DisplayName LIKE '%Community%';"

content.content:
-1|1|2010-07-19 06:55:26.0|Community|2010-07-19 06:55:26.0|http://meta.stackexchange.com/|on the server farm|

Hi, I'm not really a person.

I'm a background process that helps keep this site clean!

I do things like

  • Randomly poke old unanswered questions every hour so they get some attention
  • Own community questions and answers so nobody gets unnecessary reputation from them
  • Own downvotes on spam/evil posts that get permanently deleted
  • Own suggested edits from anonymous users
  • Remove abandoned questions
|0|5007|1920|-1||
